trans-unit.source: Exposes properties that contain federation settings that control the behavior of the WS-Federation Authentication Module (<xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationAuthenticationModule"></xref>) and the Session Authentication Module (<xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionAuthenticationModule"></xref>) in web applications.

By default web applications have a single <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> object that is accessed through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthentication.FederationConfiguration?displayProperty=fullName> property.

The first time the property is accessed a new <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> instance is initialized from settings in the configuration file and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthentication.FederationConfigurationCreated?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised.

You can use the properties and methods exposed by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> class to modify or replace the object initialized from configuration in an event handler.

This object is available through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfigurationCreatedEventArgs.FederationConfiguration%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property inside the event handler.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration"></xref> class by loading settings from the `system.identityModel.services` section of the configuration file.
The properties in the new instance are initialized by loading settings from the `<system.identityModel.services>` configuration section.

This constructor calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.%23ctor%28System.Boolean%29?displayProperty=fullName> constructor with the `loadConfig` parameter `true`.

Before the new <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> instance is used by any of the configured HTTP modules, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.Initialize%2A> method to ensure that the instance is properly initialized.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration"></xref> class by optionally loading settings from the `system.identityModel.services` section of the configuration file.

Before the new <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> instance is used by any of the configured HTTP modules, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.Initialize%2A> method to ensure that the instance is properly initialized.
The `system.identityModel` section must be specified in a `<section>` element under the `<configSections>` element in the configuration file or an exception is thrown.
If `loadConfig` is `true` and only a single `<federationConfiguration>` element is specified, settings are loaded using that element.

If multiple `<federationConfiguration>` elements are specified, the method attempts to load settings from the element that is unnamed of that has the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.DefaultFederationConfigurationName>.
If such an element does not exist, the method returns without loading settings.
This results in an exception when the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.Initialize%2A> method is called.

Microsoft recommends that if you specify multiple `<federationConfiguration>` elements in the `system.identityModel.services` configuration section that at least one of them is unnamed or has its name set to an empty string.
`true` to initialize with settings loaded from the configuration file; `false` to initialize to default values.
The `system.identityModel` configuration section is not defined in the configuration file.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration"></xref> class from the [\<federationConfiguration\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/federationconfiguration.md) element with the specified name.

Before the new <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> instance is used by any of the configured HTTP modules, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.Initialize%2A> method to ensure that the instance is properly initialized.

If this constructor is called then a `<system.identityModel.services>` configuration section with a `<federationConfiguration>` element that has the specified name must exist in the configuration file.

Both the `system.identityModel` section and the `system.identityModel.services` must be specified in a `<section>` elements under the `<configSections>` element in the configuration file or an exception is thrown.
The name of the `<federationConfiguration>` element from which to load the configuration.
There is no `system.identityModel.services` section defined in the configuration file.
-or-
There is no `system.identityModel` section defined in the configuration file.
-or-
There is no `<federationConfiguration>` element with the specified name in the `system.identityModel.services` section.
Gets or sets the cookie handler to be used by the Session Authentication Module (<xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionAuthenticationModule"></xref>).
Specifies the cookie handler that is used to read and write session cookies by the SAM.
When initialized from a configuration file, this property is set by the [\<cookieHandler\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/cookiehandler.md) element.
The cookie handler to be used by the Session Authentication Module (SAM).
An attempt to set the property to `null` occurs.
Gets or sets the custom XML element, if any, present in this configuration.
The custom XML element.

Defines the name of the default [\<federationConfiguration\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/federationconfiguration.md) element from which settings should be loaded.
This is an empty string as the default element is unnamed.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration"></xref> object associated with this instance.

When initialized from a configuration file, this property is set by the [\<identityConfiguration\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/identityconfiguration.md) element.
The identity configuration object associated with this instance.
An attempt to set the property to `null` occurs.
Initializes the current instance.
This method ensures that the current instance is properly initialized before it is used by the HTTP Modules to process incoming requests.
It should only be called once.
Check the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.IsInitialized%2A> property before calling the method.
This method sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.IsInitialized%2A> property is set `true`.

The default implementation creates a default cookie handler if there is not one already configured through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.CookieHandler%2A> property and calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration.Initialize%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method on the identity configuration object that is configured through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.IdentityConfiguration%2A> property.
You can override this method to modify this behavior or to provide additional initialization in derived classes.
This method should be invoked before the class is used by the HTTP Modules to process incoming requests.
The current instance has already been initialized (The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.IsInitialized"></xref> property is `true`.)
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.Initialize"></xref> method has been called.
Use this property to check whether the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> object has already been initialized.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.Initialize%2A> method should be called once and only once.
The `set` operation is `protected`.
`true` if the configuration object has been configured; otherwise `false`.
Loads the properties for the current instance from the configuration file.
This method is called by constructors that initialize the newly created <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration"></xref> from configuration settings.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.LoadConfiguration%2A> method is called by the constructors to set the properties of the newly created <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> object from the specified `<federationConfiguration>` element.
If `element` is `null`, the instance is loaded with default values.
If the there is no configuration file, or, if the named section does not exist, then no exception is thrown, instead the instance is loaded with default values.
The `<federationConfiguration>` element to load settings from.
Can be `null` to load default values.
Gets the name associated with this instance.
Corresponds to the `name` attribute of a [\<federationConfiguration\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/federationconfiguration.md) element.
The name associated with this federation configuration instance.
Gets or sets the X.509 certificate used to sign WS-Federation protocol messages.

When initialized from a configuration file, this property is set by the [\<serviceCertificate\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/servicecertificate.md) element.
The X.509 certificate used to sign WS-Federation protocol messages.
Gets or sets the configuration settings for the WS-Federation Authentication Module (<xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationAuthenticationModule"></xref>).
When initialized from a configuration file, this property is set by the [\<wsFederation\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/wsfederation.md) element.
The configuration settings for the WS-Federation Authentication Module.
An attempt to set the property to `null` occurs.
